name: Dar-us-Sakina
mission: DAR-US-SAKINA IS A 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO INCLUSION OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY OF HOUSTON. OUR PLATFORM IS A SAFE SPACE FOR PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. WE INSPIRE THE COMMUNITY TO ABANDON STIGMAS AND EMBRACE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITH EMPATHY AND RESPECT. TOGETHER, WE ARE BETTER.
theoryOfChange: Dar-us-Sakina outlines its strategic approach through its stated mission, vision, and values, and details its programming within three key service areas: education, support, and community awareness. Their mission is to provide inclusive opportunities and resources to individuals with disabilities and their caregivers in the Muslim community of Houston, with a vision for a community where individuals with disabilities are fully accepted and included, and have adequate access to resources and support. Their core values are Compassion, Acceptance, Responsibility, and Empathy. The charity implements this through programs such as the Sakina Internship Program, Volunteer Enrichment Program, Youth Inclusion Training, and Community Events, all designed to foster inclusivity and change community perceptions. An external article further describes their model as one that 'uses faith values to drive the work outside of the traditional congregational space' and 'offers an inclusive community that seeks to strengthen educational and social support for families,' integrating Islamic values to advance parent support and empowerment.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Dar-us-Sakina shows high alignment with Muslim donors as a zakat-eligible institution addressing the urgent need for disability inclusion within religious spaces [8][11]. Its track record includes training community members in disability awareness and providing direct family support through a dedicated Zakat Fund [10][12].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building for students with special needs, maintaining a program expense ratio of 72.2% [1][2]. While the cost per beneficiary is approximately $3,948, the charity demonstrates effectiveness through specialized Islamic education and caregiver support groups [9][10].

baseline_narrative.headline: Dar-us-Sakina empowers individuals with disabilities in the Houston Muslim community through inclusive education and specialized support services.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 93.0/100
Strong liquidity with 15.9 months of working capital available
Efficient fundraising operations spending only $0.13 to raise every $1
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Houston, Dar-us-Sakina provides inclusive opportunities and Islamic education for individuals with special needs while empowering their families [3][6]. The organization operates several key initiatives including the Sakina Sunday School and a dedicated internship program to foster community integration [4][5].

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="1">93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting high standards of transparency and governance.
Dar-us-Sakina spends only <cite id="1">$0.13 to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions reach the programs.
The charity holds <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive safety net for its specialized services.

strengths_deep_dive: Dar-us-Sakina's operational excellence is anchored by its <cite id="1">72.2% independent board</cite> and comprehensive governance policies. Financially, the organization has shown rapid growth, increasing its <cite id="2">contributions to $398,320</cite> in 2023 while maintaining a <cite id="2">72.2% program expense ratio</cite> according to recent filings. This efficiency is paired with high-impact programming, such as the <cite id="9">Sakina Sunday School</cite>, which provides religious education to students who are often excluded from mainstream Islamic schools.
rich_narrative.summary: Dar-us-Sakina is a Houston-based nonprofit dedicated to <cite id="3">empowering individuals with disabilities</cite> within the Muslim community through inclusive education and specialized support services. The organization addresses a critical gap in community infrastructure by providing <cite id="6">Islamic education tailored to special needs</cite> and fostering social integration. In the 2023 fiscal year, the charity reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $540,354</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.6%</cite>. Their operational model is highly efficient, maintaining <cite id="1">a 93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 for Culture and Leadership</cite>. Beyond education, the organization provides <cite id="10">Zakat-funded support for families</cite> and operates a <cite id="4">Teen and Adult Program (TAP)</cite> to assist with vocational skills and community participation. Their financial health is exceptionally robust, with <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite> held in working capital, ensuring long-term stability for their specialized programs.
